title: You’ll see a very different Karl, tonight
text:
Karl’s Verdict: ‘I won’t be naked, but I’m willing to talk about nakedness’ Charlotte Willis news.com.au Karl’s Verdict: ‘I won’t be naked, but I’m willing to talk about nakedness’ Charlotte Willis news.com.au Karl Stefanovic will act as ‘chair’ for Nine’s new panel show, The Verdict. 
ANYONE tuning into the premiere of The Verdict tonight expecting a healthy dose of Karl Stefanovic’s loveable larrikin behaviour, think again. 
The TV host fronts Nine’s new Q&A-style panel show, alongside seven panellists (including former federal Labor leader and “stay-at-home dad” Mark Latham) and said he’ll be playing this one “pretty straightforward”. 
“I won’t be naked, but I’m willing to talk about nakedness,” Stefanovic told news.com.au when asked if we’ll be seeing any ‘Karlesque’ stunts. “I won’t be stripping off, I’ll just be trying to strip down debates, but you never know how it’s going to unfold so I’m looking forward to putting my head down and exploring that.” 
The current affairs program will see the Today co-host tackle a slightly different role, serving as ‘chair’ while a rotating panel debates hot button topics making headlines around the nation. 
“We don’t want anyone to sit on the fence here. I think everyone will find someone who reflects their opinions and it’s going to be up to me, I’m going to have my hands full trying to balance everyone but there will be opinions there for everyone. 
“One of my jobs is going to be to try and extract the most coherent, pointed opinion from each of them to try and drill down on what they really think.” Other Stories
